Class RightTriangle

  • java.lang.Object
    • RightTriangle
  • public class RightTriangle
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a right triangle. Every triangle created using this class has three sides of positive length: a base, a height and a hypotenuse. The three sides always satisfy the pythagorean theorem (i.e. the square of the hypotenuse is equal to the sum of the squares of the other two sides).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      RightTriangle()
      Creates a right triangle with base and height both of length 1.0.
      RightTriangle​(double bs, double ht)
      Creates a right triangle with base of bs and height of ht if these are positive.

      Compares this right triangle to the other.

      Calculates the area of this right triangle as a double.

      Used to get the height of the right triangle as a double.
      double getHeight()
      Used to get the height of the right triangle as a double.
      double getHypotenuse()
      Calculates the length the hypotenuse of the right triangle and returns this as a double.
      double getPerimeter()
      Calculates the perimeter of this right triangle as a double.

      Sets the base of the right triangle to the specified length.
      void setHeight​(double ht)
      Sets the height of the right triangle to the specified length.
      java.lang.String toString()
      A String representation of this right triangle.

    • Constructor Detail

      • RightTriangle

        public RightTriangle()
        Creates a right triangle with base and height both of length 1.0.

      • RightTriangle

        public RightTriangle​(double bs,
                     double ht)
        Creates a right triangle with base of bs and height of ht if these are positive. If either is not positive, set the length of that side to 1.0.
        Parameters:
        bs - The proposed base of the new triangle. This should be a positive number.
        ht - The proposed height of the new triangle. This should be a positive number.

    • Method Detail

      • setBase

        public void setBase​(double bs)
        Sets the base of the right triangle to the specified length. This also changes the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle, but not the height.
        Parameters:
        bs - the proposed new base. This should be a positive number.

      • setHeight

        public void setHeight​(double ht)
        Sets the height of the right triangle to the specified length. This also changes the length of the hypotenuse of the triangle, but not the height.
        Parameters:
        ht - the proposed new height. This should be a positive number.

      • getBase

        public double getBase()
        Used to get the height of the right triangle as a double.
        Returns:
        the height of the right triangle.

      • getHeight

        public double getHeight()
        Used to get the height of the right triangle as a double.
        Returns:
        the height of the right triangle.

      • getHypotenuse

        public double getHypotenuse()
        Calculates the length the hypotenuse of the right triangle and returns this as a double.
        Returns:
        the hypotenuse of the right triangle.

      • getArea

        public double getArea()
        Calculates the area of this right triangle as a double.
        Returns:
        the area of the right triangle.

      • getPerimeter

        public double getPerimeter()
        Calculates the perimeter of this right triangle as a double.
        Returns:
        the perimeter of the right triangle.

      • equals

        public boolean equals​(RightTriangle other)
        Compares this right triangle to the other. The result is true if and only if the base and height of this right triangle are equal to the base and height respectively of the other right triangle.
        Returns:
        true if the other right triangle has the same base and height as this one, false otherwise.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        A String representation of this right triangle. This is in the form "right triangle with base a, height b, hypotenuse c", where a, b and c are the doubles representing the base, height and hypotenuse of the right triangle.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a String representation of this right triangle.
